Package fr.upmc.components.registry

Global registry for the publication of component ports.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConnectionData
    The class ConnectionData represents the data stored by the reqistry to know for each port on which host the port is published on the RMI registry.
    GlobalRegistry
    The class GlobalRegistry implements the global registry for the component model that registers connection information to remotely access components through their ports.
    GlobalRegistry.ProcessLookup
    The class ProcessLookup implements a runnable task used to look up the registry for a given key.
    GlobalRegistry.ProcessPut
    The class ProcessPut implements a runnable task used to update the registry with the association of a given key to a given value.
    GlobalRegistry.ProcessRemove
    The class ProcessRemove implements a runnable task used to remove the association of a given key from the registry.
    GlobalRegistry.ServiceRunnable
    The class ServiceRunnable implements the behaviour of the registry exchanging with one client; its processes the requests from the clients until the latter explicitly disconnects with a "shutdown" request of implicitly with a null string request.
    GlobalRegistryClient
    The class RegistryClient provides a convenient intermediary to send requests to the registry and get answers back.
    SocketUtilities
    The class SocketUtilities implements utilities for managing socket communications for the registry.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ConnectionType
    The class ConnectionType defines an enumerated type of connection that can be used in the componenbt model.

Package fr.upmc.components.registry Description

Global registry for the publication of component ports.

The RMI registry implementation coming in open implementation of Java typically forbids the modification of an entry done from a remote host. Hence, storing entries must be done on the same host as where the request is made. To circumvent this limitation, each host is running its own copy of the RMI registry, and publication is done locally to the host. But then, one need to know on which host to send a RMI request when trying to connect to a remote object. The class GlobalRegistry implements a simple central registry where to store the information about the host running the RMI registry on which some object has been published. The class GlobalRegistryClient implements the client side of the registry, a singleton of which must exist in each of the JVM where requests must be sent to this global registry.
